page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: We went up to the crossroads by St. Andrews church to do a traffic survey. We discovered the road to Sudbury was the busiest, 256 vehicles an hour and on market day there were 408 vehicles travelling in the same direction. It is very difficult for lorry drivers to turn. One lorry had to drive on the pavement to turn into Hedingham Road from Colchester Road. There is normally a long queue going to Braintree. We wrote down the registration numbers of the lorries. Most of them were not local. Some of them were from as far away as Scotland. On market day more of the lorries were local.
